prompt: <description>**Part 1:Construct a long, thin, rectangular prism with a slightly tapered shape, narrowing slightly towards the top.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles [0, 0, 0] and translation vector [0, 0, 0.0288]. - Sketch: 1. Draw a line from point [0, 0] to point [0.0577, 0]. 2. Draw a line from point [0.0577, 0] to point [0.0577, 0.1846]. 3. Draw an arc from point [0.0577, 0.1846] to point [0.0115, 0.2308] with midpoint at [0.0251, 0.1981]. 4. Draw a line from point [0.0115, 0.2308] to point [0.0115, 0.75]. 5. Draw a line from point [0.0115, 0.75] to point [0, 0.75]. 6. Draw a line from point [0, 0.75] to point [0, 0]. Note: There are 5 lines and 1 arc in this sketch forming a single loop. - Extrusion: 1. Scale the sketch by 0.75. 2. Extrude the sketch by 0.0577 towards the normal and do not extrude in the opposite direction. 3. Operation: Create a new solid body. **Part 2: Construct two cylindrical objects with a smaller cylinder inside each larger cylinder.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles [90, 0, -90] and translation vector [0, 0.1587, 0.0433]. - Sketch: 1. On face_1, draw a circle with radius 0.0144 and center at [0.0144, 0.0144]. 2. On face_2, draw a circle with radius 0.0144 and center at [0.101, 0.0144]. - Extrusion: 1. Do not scale the sketch. 2. Extrude the circle in face_1 by 0.1154 in the opposite direction of the normal and do not extrude in the direction of the normal. 3. Extrude the circle in face_2 by 0.1154 in the opposite direction of the normal and do not extrude in the direction of the normal. 4. Operation: Cut the current part with the preceding part. **Final Shape** The length, width and height of the final shape are as follows: - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.1154 - Height: 0.75</description>
